meanings.definition: Not securely fixed or in place.
meanings.sent1: The unfirm table wobbled when I placed my drink on it.
meanings.sent2: The unfirm ladder was dangerous to climb.
meanings.sent3: The unfirm chair kept tipping over, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her unfirm grasp on reality made her prone to anxiety.
meanings.sent5: The unfirm ground beneath our feet felt like walking on a trampoline.

meanings.sent1: The unfirm bridge swayed in the strong wind.
meanings.sent2: His unfirm handshake showed his nervousness.
meanings.sent3: The unfirm rope swing made for an exciting but shaky ride.
meanings.sent4: Their unfirm alliance crumbled under pressure.
meanings.sent5: The unfirm foundation of the building caused it to collapse easily.

meanings.sent1: Her unfirm decision left everyone waiting in uncertainty.
meanings.sent2: The unfirm weather forecast made planning difficult.
meanings.sent3: The unfirm answer confused the students during the quiz.
meanings.sent4: His unfirm commitment to the project caused delays.
meanings.sent5: The unfirm promise hung in the air, unfulfilled and vague.
